page.title: 09FRANCES RIDLEY HAVERGAL
page.content: The sixth daughter of Canon W.H. Havergal, Rector of Astley from 1816- 1841, Frances gained an international reputation. {Born in the Rectory in 1836,}she was a very talented child, able to read the bible at the age of four. Her mother died when Frances was only eleven and she had to leave school at thirteen because of poor health. She had three books of poems published and of the many hymns she wrote probably the most well-known is {"Take my life and let it be {consecrated, Lord, to Thee."}Frances was also a very able composer. {She died in 1879}and her tombstone is on the left of the path to the South door next to that of her father, under the Scot's Pine which he planted in 1836.
